dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 3806 IH: Alaskan Pollock and Golden King Crab Labeling Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Herrera Beutler (for herself and Mr. Young of Alaska) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To establish certain requirements with respect to pollock and golden king crab.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Alaskan Pollock and Golden King Crab Labeling Act.

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, for purposes of applying the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 301 et seq.)â€”

paragraph.text: the acceptable market name of Gadus chalcogrammus, formerly known as Theragra chalcogramma, is pollock; and
the acceptable market name of Lithodes aequispinus is golden king crab.

subsection.text: Section 403 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 343) is amended by adding at the end the following:

If it is labeled or advertised as Alaskan pollock or Alaska pollock and it is not pollock that is harvested in the exclusive economic zone (as that term is defined in the section 3 of the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act (16 U.S.C. 1802)) or the State waters adjacent to the State of Alaska.
